p: Lavender ( Lavandula angustifolia) is cultivated worldwide for its EOs, which are used in perfumes, cosmetics, food processing and, more recently, in aromatherapy products. Lavender inhalation has been used in folk medicine for the treatment of anxiety. It was reported that lavender scent reduces the anxiety state in dental patients [ 59]. Chioca et al. [ 35] reported that the EO of the plant probably exerted its anxiolytic effect through serotonergic but not GABAergic neurotransmission [ 35]. Lavender contains linalool and linalyl acetate as its main bioactive components [ 60, 61].
